summary: Is it just me or does Qyburn look disturbed with Cersei in this shot?
title: Is it just me or does Qyburn look disturbed with Cersei in this shot?
body:
This is the same guy who brought the Mountain back as a brain dead zombie, was looking at the Wight hand like he just found himself a brand new toy and was kicked out of the Citadel for essentially being disturbing.

And yet his looking at Cersei as if she’s lost her mind (shocker).

I mean look at his face…

This the face of a man who is shooketh.

This the face of a man who is shooketh.

summary: Just wanna announce that I decided to do a 7 toddler challenge thing with the house stark kiddos and ned and even with only one...
body: Just wanna announce that I decided to do a 7 toddler challenge thing with the house stark kiddos and ned and even with only one or two traits they’re hella in character and it’s spectacular. Just finished aging them up to children (might continue the challenge bc it literally took me maybe 5 or 6 irl hours lol) and while there’s a whole room of kid beds right next door, jon is fuckin napping on ned’s bed, sansa is the only child who independently took themselves to school this Monday morning, theon and robb are play fighting in the living room, and rickon is running around outside in the backyard freezing his little ass off.

tags: it’s not anti but i don’t have the energy
summary: GOT Trailer - What Didn’t We See?
body:
GOT Trailer - What Didn’t We See?

By now, everyone has gone over every millisecond of the new S8 Game of Thrones trailer with a fine tooth comb (if you’re looking for a quality analysis, both @fortunatelylori and @thelawyerthatwaspromised have great break downs of the trailer). So I won’t add my voice to the mix in regards to what was included in the trailer, but I did want to discuss what wasn’t included.

As expected, the trailer was tightly edited. We were given very little that wasn’t set up the previous season and as many have already discussed, the trailer seems to focus on the first three episodes and the battle with the White Walkers. I know some people dismiss the importance of GOT trailers, but on the whole, they do tend to tell a cohesive story in relation to each season’s narrative arc. Therefore, you can tell just as much by what is omitted from the trailer as to what is included, especially when the expected is missing.

So what was missing from the trailer that the audience expected to see, especially in light of S7?

1. Daenerys and her dragons missing from the White Walker battle.

At the end of S7, Daenerys, her dragons and her army were heading North to “save” it from the approaching Army of the Dead. Jon (and the majority of the GA) is convinced that the dragons are key to defeating the Night King (while the dragons have the potential to be effective in thinning out the wights, the White Walkers are immune to fire). So like @jonsalways asked, where is Daenerys? I expected a token shot of her riding Drogon, a dragon breathing fire and destroying wights - something that demonstrated her self-appointed role as saviour of the North. Instead, we have have Daenerys arriving at Winterfell, approaching Jon in the crypts, visiting her dragons and being very pretty and apprehensive in Winterfell. Which is an odd decision, because Daenerys role in defeating the Army of the Dead is taken as canon by some viewers, so a shot of her atop Drogon is not only expected, but it gives absolutely nothing away. So why isn’t she there?

2. Where is Bran and Tyrion?

Both Bran and Tyrion appear only once in the trailer. Bran in the first 30 seconds and Tyrion in the last 30 seconds. Considering their narrative importance, their omission from the battle with the White Walkers is pretty conspicuous. Bran has spent seven seasons preparing for this moment, and while many are placing their bets of Daenerys being the key to defeating the Night King, my money is on Bran. Therefore it makes sense to play down Bran’s importance, only to blindside the audience with how Bran is integral in defeating the Night King.

Tyrion’s absence from the battle is expected. He is Hand of the Queen and not expected to take up arms. But Tyrion is also absent (at least from the brief shots from the trailer) from where he is expected to be - either with Davos pacing the battlements or in the crypts with Varys. So why wasn’t he shown? Is he no longer in Winterfell?

3. Where is Sansa?

Sansa’s absence from the battle is also expected, and while it could indicate absolutely nothing, I was surprised that Sansa wasn’t shown waiting out the battle in the crypts with Varys (similar to her waiting out the siege of Kings Landing with Cersei in S2). Instead, they chose two shots of Sansa looking concerned - both of which followed (coincidentally I’m sure) a Jon and Daenerys scene.

4. Oh Theon, where art thou?

S7 ended with Theon on his way to rescue Yara from Euron’s clutches. Therefore I think it’s unlikely that he will play a part in the fight against the Army of the Dead and his absence isn’t that odd. I tend to think that he’ll play a bigger part in the second half of the season, so the question isn’t why wasn’t he featured, but what will role be after he succeeds/fails in rescuing Yara?

blog.name: alle23212
blog.title: Alle.
blog.description:
librisognierealta.it è il mio blog.
Ho sempre sentito il bisogno di averne uno, ma non avevo mai trovato un argomento che mi spingesse a continuare a scrivere, finché non ho abbracciato la mia natura ossessia-compulsiva e assolutamente pignola! Da questo è nato il mio blog di recensioni e scleri di vario genere: Libri, Sogni e Realtà.

summary: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones - Sesta stagione
title: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones - Sesta stagione
body:
Siamo arrivati alla fine del nostro percorso alla scoperta delle differenze tra la serie tv realizzata dalla HBO e i romanzi infiniti di Martin… Cliccate per scoprire tutte le differenze della sesta stagione :)

Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones – Sesta stagione

Quando abbiamo trattato la quinta stagione, ho detto che era la fine delle differenze, invece siamo ancora qui.

Questo perché, nella stagione sei, la prima parte delle storie di quattro personaggi (Jaime, Sam, Bran e Arya) è ancora tratta dal quarto e dal quinto libro.

Vediamo un po’ di riuscire a sintetizzare il tutto in un solo articolo.

L…

View On WordPress

title: Emotional Context
body:
The Winterfell battle is supposed to be the longest filmed battle in cinema history, and that the director of the episode really considered how to make sure the audience does not feel fatigued.

He pushed the actors to think about what happened to them between each of their scenes, and it is implied he tried to make the audience care about the individual characters on the set. So he actually tried to lessen the fighting in some scenes for a powerful effect.

I think there is going to be an unexpected subplot to intrigue the viewers further, and each of the primary characters are slowly brought into that mystery as the episode unfolds.

The Sansa kidnapping subplot fills all the blanks here, and I think even the viewer won’t realize what is happening at first. We will know that Cersei is planning to betray the Starks, but not how, and when Winterfell is attacked by the living, it changes the game for everyone in the castle.

It would be bittersweet if Jaime who was so focused on fighting for the living ended up having to slaughter a lot of the living in order to protect Winterfell.

The big problem will occur after all those Golden company and Ironborn soldiers are killed and then reanimated by the Great Other. Jon and his forces will think they have won, but then they lost their ground and Winterfell is completely overrun by a force they did not anticipate. In the confusion, Sansa will be taken and confused for dead.

blog.name: hileywwe
blog.title: My World
blog.description: Hello loves🔥 my name is Crystal ❤️/ 20 / Black 😘/ England native / Game of thrones is LIFE ♥ Star wars is LIFE 🖤/jonerys IS my life😍/kit and emilia are goals/positivity and laughter all around/ so if you don't like what I put here oh wells x

summary:
4.05 is the reaction 💞💞
Also... Why is she me? 😂
body:

blog.description: Friends/GOT/Vikings/BB/Westworld/Sherlock/B99/The Handmaid's tale/Gossip Girl/TEOTFW/SPN//THE100/The Office/Marvel Movies/Christopher Nolan Movies/ Harry Potter/ Bookworm/ Daydreamer/ Night thinker/

body:
About GoT spoilers

Hey, guys, GoT season 8 is approaching and I see some people who have read the leaks post stuff. I saw that you had used the tags got spoilers. However, before I got to that part, smth already caught my attention. I’m not sure if these leaks correspond to reality, but please when you write a post about them put smth in the title so that the show isn’t spoiled for the people who don’t want to read spoilers,. Thanks in advance and sorry if I somehow offended smb by this post!

summary: Sansa isn’t inside Winterfell Crypt with people. And if this scene is Parallel of “Blackwater war”.  Do you remember where is...
body:
Sansa isn’t inside Winterfell Crypt with people. And if this scene is Parallel of “Blackwater war”. Do you remember where is Cersei in this moment? On the throne with Tommen and tried to gave poison. She wanted to kill him until Enemy comes. But Tywin entered the castle before she made it. Because Lannisters win this war. But we already knows that Winterfell lost this war and castle is gone.

What do you think?

blog.name: to-read-is-to-breathe
blog.title: To Read is To Breathe
blog.description: Read like there will always be one more book, Write as if you are pulling words from your heart, and Fangirl like there's no tomorrow.

tags: to read is to breathe songs of 2019
title: Songs of 2019
body:
March 7, 2019

As the final season for Game of Thrones approaches, it seems only fair that I discuss one of my favorite pieces from the score. 

You’ll be Queen One Day, from: Game of Thrones, composed by: Ramin Djawadi

I love this piece. I love a lot of the pieces Djawadi has composed for GOT, but I love this one a lot. It has found its way into my writing playlist, and is currently one of my favorite instrumental tracks to turn to when I need a little extra zap of creativity.

Languid and acoustic in sound, this piece conveys some of the rare feelings of hope that existed long before many of the twists and turns of the show began. It captures some of the lightness, some of the good; that inherent sense of “it will all work out in the end,”–even though we know by now that we should definitely not put any faith into that statement. 

It is quietly regal and elegant, speaking to the royalty and thrones at play, though without the intensity of when the game is finally afoot. It hands you atmosphere and the tiniest bit of plot–enough to be mysterious but not enough to give anything away. 

It is an introduction, a quick peek into what could be, but will most definitely not; the calm before the storm. The moment of peace that walks onward, unknowing that the ground beneath its feet is only moments from giving way and that everything is about to change. 

All of this–the atmosphere, the delicate sense of foreboding buried underneath light and blinking rays of hope–lends to the overall tone of the piece, making it unique and striking; especially when considered against all that we know about the show in hindsight. 

It is one of those short and sweet, near-perfect pieces of music that is crafted unbelievably well. You’ll Be Queen One Day is versatile in its ability to be creatively applied while clinging to that distinctive tone that makes it intriguing to begin with. 

As the end of GOT approaches, I think I’ll find myself listening to this piece more and more. While it was, in a sense, the beginning, there is something about it that also feels final–a curtain drawing closed and the lights coming back up. The melancholic end to something that has been with us for many years. 

And there is no other song I’d rather hear when it makes its last farewell.

blog.description: I reblog whatever I want, whenever I want.

summary: My Gendrya heart is reeling. My goodness those two youngins deserve the world and each other. I want them to sail off into the...
body:
My Gendrya heart is reeling. My goodness those two youngins deserve the world and each other. I want them to sail off into the sunset when they’ve found closure after their vendettas against the Lannisters are over. Man I’m just so damn ready for Gendrya reunion, Gendrya kiss, Gendrya holding hands, etc.

@HBO
